verses.kjv: After these things Paul departed from Athens, and came to Corinth;
verses.ct: After this, Paul left Athens and traveled to Corinth.

verses.kjv: And found a certain Jew named Aquila, born in Pontus, lately come from Italy, with his wife Priscilla; (because that Claudius had commanded all Jews to depart from Rome:) and came unto them.
verses.ct: There he met a Jewish man named Aquila, originally from Pontus, who had recently arrived from Italy with his wife Priscilla. They had left because Emperor Claudius had ordered all Jews to leave Rome. Paul went to stay with them.

verses.kjv: And because he was of the same craft, he abode with them, and wrought: for by their occupation they were tentmakers.
verses.ct: Since Paul shared the same trade as they did, he stayed with them and worked alongside them — they were all tentmakers by profession.

verses.kjv: And he reasoned in the synagogue every sabbath, and persuaded the Jews and the Greeks.
verses.ct: Every Sabbath, Paul would debate in the synagogue, trying to convince both Jews and Greeks.

verses.kjv: And when Silas and Timotheus were come from Macedonia, Paul was pressed in the spirit, and testified to the Jews that Jesus was Christ.
verses.ct: When Silas and Timothy arrived from Macedonia, Paul devoted himself entirely to preaching, declaring to the Jews that Jesus was the Messiah.

verses.kjv: And when they opposed themselves, and blasphemed, he shook his raiment, and said unto them, Your blood be upon your own heads; I am clean: from henceforth I will go unto the Gentiles.
verses.ct: But when they resisted and insulted him, he shook out his clothing and told them, "Your fate is your own responsibility. I'm not to blame. From now on, I'm going to the Gentiles."

verses.kjv: And he departed thence, and entered into a certain man’s house, named Justus, one that worshipped God, whose house joined hard to the synagogue.
verses.ct: So he left the synagogue and went to the house of a man named Justus, a worshiper of God whose home was right next door to the synagogue.

verses.kjv: And Crispus, the chief ruler of the synagogue, believed on the Lord with all his house; and many of the Corinthians hearing believed, and were baptized.
verses.ct: Crispus, the synagogue leader, put his faith in the Lord along with his entire household. Many Corinthians who heard the message also believed and were baptized.

verses.kjv: Then spake the Lord to Paul in the night by a vision, Be not afraid, but speak, and hold not thy peace:
verses.ct: One night the Lord spoke to Paul through a vision: "Don't be afraid. Keep speaking and don't stay silent,

verses.kjv: For I am with thee, and no man shall set on thee to hurt thee: for I have much people in this city.
verses.ct: because I am with you. No one will lay a hand on you to harm you, because I have many people in this city."

verses.kjv: And he continued there a year and six months, teaching the word of God among them.
verses.ct: So Paul stayed there for a year and 6 months, teaching the word of God among them.

verses.kjv: And when Gallio was the deputy of Achaia, the Jews made insurrection with one accord against Paul, and brought him to the judgment seat,
verses.ct: While Gallio was serving as governor of Achaia, the Jews united against Paul and dragged him before the judgment seat.

verses.kjv: Saying, This fellow persuadeth men to worship God contrary to the law.
verses.ct: They accused him, saying, "This man is persuading people to worship God in ways that violate the law."

verses.kjv: And when Paul was now about to open his mouth, Gallio said unto the Jews, If it were a matter of wrong or wicked lewdness, O ye Jews, reason would that I should bear with you:
verses.ct: Paul was just about to respond when Gallio said to the Jews, "If this involved some crime or serious wrongdoing, I would have good reason to hear your case.

verses.kjv: But if it be a question of words and names, and of your law, look ye to it; for I will be no judge of such matters.
verses.ct: But since this is a dispute about terminology, names, and your own religious law, deal with it yourselves. I refuse to serve as judge over these matters."

verses.kjv: And he drave them from the judgment seat.
verses.ct: Then he had them removed from the judgment seat.

verses.kjv: Then all the Greeks took Sosthenes, the chief ruler of the synagogue, and beat him before the judgment seat. And Gallio cared for none of those things.
verses.ct: The whole crowd then grabbed Sosthenes, the synagogue leader, and beat him right there in front of the judgment seat. But Gallio showed no concern about any of it.

verses.kjv: And Paul after this tarried there yet a good while, and then took his leave of the brethren, and sailed thence into Syria, and with him Priscilla and Aquila; having shorn his head in Cenchrea: for he had a vow.
verses.ct: Paul remained in Corinth for quite a while longer. Then he said goodbye to the brothers and sisters and sailed for Syria, taking Priscilla and Aquila with him. Before leaving, he had his head shaved at Cenchrea because of a vow he had made.

verses.kjv: And he came to Ephesus, and left them there: but he himself entered into the synagogue, and reasoned with the Jews.
verses.ct: They arrived at Ephesus, where Paul left Priscilla and Aquila. He went into the synagogue and debated with the Jews.

verses.kjv: When they desired him to tarry longer time with them, he consented not;
verses.ct: They asked him to stay longer, but he declined.

verses.kjv: But bade them farewell, saying, I must by all means keep this feast that cometh in Jerusalem: but I will return again unto you, if God will. And he sailed from Ephesus.
verses.ct: Instead, he said goodbye and told them, "I need to attend the upcoming festival in Jerusalem, but I will come back to you if God wills it." Then he sailed from Ephesus.

verses.kjv: And when he had landed at Caesarea, and gone up, and saluted the church, he went down to Antioch.
verses.ct: After landing at Caesarea, he went up and greeted the church, then traveled down to Antioch.

verses.kjv: And after he had spent some time there, he departed, and went over all the country of Galatia and Phrygia in order, strengthening all the disciples.
verses.ct: He spent some time there before leaving and traveling systematically through the regions of Galatia and Phrygia, strengthening all the disciples along the way.

verses.kjv: And a certain Jew named Apollos, born at Alexandria, an eloquent man, and mighty in the scriptures, came to Ephesus.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, a Jewish man named Apollos arrived in Ephesus. He was originally from Alexandria, a gifted speaker, and deeply knowledgeable in the Scriptures.

verses.kjv: This man was instructed in the way of the Lord; and being fervent in the spirit, he spake and taught diligently the things of the Lord, knowing only the baptism of John.
verses.ct: He had been taught about the way of the Lord, and with great enthusiasm he spoke and taught accurately about Jesus, though he only knew about John's baptism.

verses.kjv: And he began to speak boldly in the synagogue: whom when Aquila and Priscilla had heard, they took him unto them, and expounded unto him the way of God more perfectly.
verses.ct: He began speaking boldly in the synagogue. When Aquila and Priscilla heard him, they took him aside and explained the way of God to him more completely.

verses.kjv: And when he was disposed to pass into Achaia, the brethren wrote, exhorting the disciples to receive him: who, when he was come, helped them much which had believed through grace:
verses.ct: When Apollos wanted to travel to Achaia, the brothers and sisters encouraged him and wrote to the disciples there, urging them to welcome him. After he arrived, he was a tremendous help to those who had come to faith through grace.

verses.kjv: For he mightily convinced the Jews, and that publickly, shewing by the scriptures that Jesus was Christ.
verses.ct: He powerfully refuted the Jews in public debate, proving from the Scriptures that Jesus was the Messiah.
